domain.controllers

Class CtrlDomain

  • java.lang.Object
    • domain.controllers.CtrlDomain

  • public class CtrlDomain
extends java.lang.Object
    Domain controller, manages the domain layer
    Author:
    Sergi Serrano Casalins, Nicolas Gouttefangeas Ballo, Marcos Riverola Errando, Samuel Hoenle

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CtrlDomain.ProblemExistsException
      An exception to flag that it was tried to add a duplicate Problemto the problemCollection

      An exception to flag that a problem is not valid

    • Constructor Detail

      • CtrlDomain

        public CtrlDomain()
           throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                  java.io.IOException
        Constructor for CtrlDomain initialising all controller attributes and loading all problems (using loadAllProblems()).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Could not read the data from the file because it is either locked or it does not have enough permissions (in CtrlGenericData.get(String) and loadAllProblems()).
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - The class of the stored object does not exist (in CtrlGenericData.get(String) and loadAllProblems()).

    • Method Detail

      • loadAllProblems

        public void loadAllProblems()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Loads all problems from the standard location using CtrlGenericData.getAll()
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Could not read the data from the file because it is either locked or it does not have enough permissions
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - The class of the stored object does not exist
        See Also:
        CtrlGenericData.getAll()

      • getListOfAllProblems

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> getListOfAllProblems()
        Returns a List of all Problems in problemCollection in String arrays to be displayed.
        Returns:
        A List of an array of Strings, each containing all information of a Problem to be displayed.
        See Also:
        listOfProblems(Collection)

      • getListOfSelectedProblems

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> getListOfSelectedProblems(java.util.List<java.lang.String> difficulties,
                                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> types,
                                                                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> names)
                                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a List of selected Problems in problemCollection in String arrays to be displayed. Problems can be selected after Difficulty, Type or the Player who created them
        Parameters:
        difficulties - A List of Strings representing Difficultys to filter after
        types - A List of Strings representing Types to filter after
        names - A List of Strings representing Player.names to filter after
        Returns:
        A List of an array of Strings, each containing all information of all selected Problems to be displayed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        listOfProblems(Collection)

      • listOfProblems

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> listOfProblems(java.util.Collection<Problem> list)
        Returns a List of String arrays, each containing the information of a Problem object to be displayed.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of Problems to be displayed
        Returns:
        A list of String arrays generated by displayableProblemInfo(Problem)
        See Also:
        displayableProblemInfo(Problem)

      • displayableProblemInfo

        private java.lang.String[] displayableProblemInfo(Problem p)
        A String array containing the information of a Problem object to be displayed. The format is: [Integer.toHexString(int) of Problem.getId() as identifier, Enum.name() of Problem.getType(), Problem.getNumRows() as String, Problem.getNumColumns() as String, Enum.name() of Problem.getDifficulty(), Problem.getCreatorName()]
        Parameters:
        p - The Problem of which the info should be displayed
        Returns:
        A String array of 6 fields

      • getDisplayableProblemInfo

        public java.lang.String[] getDisplayableProblemInfo(java.lang.String problemId)
                                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        A String array containing the information of a Problem object to be displayed. The format is: [Integer.toHexString(int) of Problem.getId() as identifier, Enum.name() of Problem.getType(), Problem.getNumRows() as String, Problem.getNumColumns() as String, Enum.name() of Problem.getDifficulty(), Problem.getCreatorName()]
        Parameters:
        problemId - The id of a Problem as its hexadecimal representation (see Problem.idAsHex(int)
        Returns:
        A String array of 6 fields
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Could not read the data from the file because it is either locked or it does not have enough permissions
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - The file can not be loaded
        See Also:
        displayableProblemInfo(Problem)

      • saveAttempt

        public java.lang.String saveAttempt(java.lang.String id,
                                    java.lang.String[][] solution,
                                    int time,
                                    java.lang.String playerName)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Saves a started Attempt in order to be able to play it later
        Parameters:
        id - problem's identifier
        solution - the current solution of the problem done by the player
        time - the time already spent of a player solving a Problem
        playerName - the player's identifier
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Could not read from Problem file or could not write on Attempt file
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        whether or not the attempt was successfully deleted

      • getHint

        public java.lang.String[] getHint(java.lang.String[][] solution,
                                  java.lang.String adjacency,
                                  int columns,
                                  int rows,
                                  java.lang.String type,
                                  int lastNumber)
        Returns the position and the number of the next step of a started player Attempt, empty string if no solution found;
        Parameters:
        solution - the current player's solution to a problem
        adjacency - the adjacency attribute of the problem being solved
        columns - the number of columns of the solution
        rows - the number of rows of the solution
        type - the type attribute of the problem being solved
        lastNumber - the last number added to the solution by the player
        Returns:
        The x and y position of the following number of a solution if solvable, empty string otherwise

        public void updateRankingAttempt(java.lang.String problemId,
                                 java.lang.Integer time)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Updates the ranking by attempt of a problem
        Parameters:
        problemId - the problem's identifier
        time - the time of the player spent doing the solution
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Could not read from Problem file, could not read from RankingAttempt file cor could not write in RankingAttempt file

      • getSolution

        public java.lang.String[][] getSolution(java.lang.String[][] solution,
                                        java.lang.String adjacency,
                                        int columns,
                                        int rows,
                                        java.lang.String type)
        Returns a matrix with the solution to the current attempt of the player
        Parameters:
        solution - the current started solution of a problem by a player
        adjacency - adjacency used in the problem
        columns - number of columns of the problem's map
        rows - number of rows of the problem's map
        type - the type of the problem
        Returns:
        the solution of the started attempt

      • loadProblemFromPath

        public java.lang.String[] loadProblemFromPath(java.lang.String path)
                                       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                              java.io.IOException,
                                              java.text.ParseException,
                                              CtrlDomain.ProblemExistsException,
                                              CtrlDomain.ProblemNotValidException
        Reads a Hidato problem from a file and parses it into a Problem instance. The format of the file is: |Type|Adjacency|#Rows|#Columns Q,CA,3,4 #,1,?,# ?,?,?,? 7,?,9,# Q=Square, T=Triangle, H=Hexagon C=Faces, CA=Faces and Edges Various checks are performed and the Difficulty is determined with Problem.determineDifficulty(String[][]).
        Parameters:
        path - The path to a text file containing an Hidato in the format above.
        Returns:
        An instance of Problem corresponding to the file passed.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown when the passed path does not link to a file.
        java.io.IOException - Can be thrown by BufferedReader.readLine()
        java.text.ParseException - The file does not fulfil the format requirements.
        CtrlDomain.ProblemExistsException
        CtrlDomain.ProblemNotValidException

      • generateProblem

        public java.lang.String[] generateProblem(java.lang.String type,
                                          int numRows,
                                          int numColumns,
                                          java.lang.String difficulty,
                                          boolean cornerAdjacent)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                          java.io.IOException
        Generates a new Problem with the parameters passed.
        Parameters:
        type - A String corresponding with the name of a Type
        numRows - The number of rows the new game should have
        numColumns - The number of columns the new game should have
        difficulty - A String corresponding with the name of a Difficulty
        cornerAdjacent - Whether fields sharing a corner should be counted as neighbours or only those sharing a face (not relevant for HexagonProblems).
        Returns:
        The displayable information of the generated Problem as generated by displayableProblemInfo(Problem), or an empty String array if adding the new Problem to problemCollection failed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Is thrown if one of the argumets is in the wrong format. Should be caught.
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        Generator.generate(Type, int, int, Difficulty, String, boolean)

      • generatePersonalizedProblem

        public java.lang.String[] generatePersonalizedProblem(java.lang.String type,
                                                      int numRows,
                                                      int numColumns,
                                                      java.lang.String difficulty,
                                                      boolean cornerAdjacent,
                                                      java.lang.String[][] map)
                                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                      java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        type - A String corresponding with the name of a Type
        numRows - The number of rows the new game should have
        numColumns - The number of columns the new game should have
        difficulty - A String corresponding with the name of a Difficulty
        cornerAdjacent - Whether fields sharing a corner should be counted as neighbours or only those sharing a face (not relevant for HexagonProblems).
        map - A map to be used in the problem generation
        Returns:
        The displayable information of the generated Problem as generated by displayableProblemInfo(Problem), or an empty String array if adding the new Problem to problemCollection failed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Is thrown if one of the argumets is in the wrong format. Should be caught.
        java.io.IOException - Could not read from a Problem file

      • savePlayer

        public void savePlayer(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String password,
                       java.lang.String path,
                       java.lang.Boolean changed)
                throws java.io.IOException
        If the username does not exist on the Player one creates a new player with the atributes in param Else overrides the atributs of the Player with the respective username
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the player
        password - The password of the Player
        path - The path of the avatar of the Player
        changed - The boolean that shows if the avatar has benn changed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Could not write in the Player File
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Outdated Player File

      • existsPlayer

        public boolean existsPlayer(java.lang.String username)
        Returns a boolean that checks if the player with the username from the param exists
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the player we want to check
        Returns:
        True if the player exists else otherwise

      • LogginPlayer

        public boolean LogginPlayer(java.lang.String username,
                            java.lang.String password)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Returns a boolean that checks if the player could be logged and sets the logged player
        Parameters:
        username - The player we want to log in
        password - The password of the player we want to log in
        Returns:
        True if it was possible to log the player in, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Could not read from the Player File
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Outdated Player FIle

      • getRankingPlayer

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getRankingPlayer()
                                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Gets a RankingPlayer previously stored in the system
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of strings, in each even position of the array there is the name of the player and the following odd position has its points.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Outdated RankingPlayer file
        java.io.IOException - Couldn't read the RankingPlayer file

      • getRankingAttempt

                                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                                               java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Gets a RankingAttempt previously stored in the system
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of strings, in each even position of the array there is the name of the player and the following odd position has its time.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Outdated RankingAttempt file
        java.io.IOException - Couldn't read the RankingAttempt file

        Validates if a problem solution is correct.
        Parameters:

        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Outdated Problem file

        public CtrlDomain()
           throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                  java.io.IOException
        Constructor for CtrlDomain initialising all controller attributes and loading all problems (using loadAllProblems()).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Could not read the data from the file because it is either locked or it does not have enough permissions (in CtrlGenericData.get(String) and loadAllProblems()).
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - The class of the stored object does not exist (in CtrlGenericData.get(String) and loadAllProblems()).

        See Also:

      • displayableProblemInfo

        private java.lang.String[] displayableProblemInfo(Problem p)
        A String array containing the information of a Problem object to be displayed. The format is: [Integer.toHexString(int) of Problem.getId() as identifier, Enum.name() of Problem.getType(), Problem.getNumRows() as String, Problem.getNumColumns() as String, Enum.name() of Problem.getDifficulty(), Problem.getCreatorName()]
        Parameters:
        p - The Problem of which the info should be displayed
        Returns:
        A String array of 6 fields

        public java.lang.String[] getDisplayableProblemInfo(java.lang.String problemId)
                                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        A String array containing the information of a Problem object to be displayed. The format is: [Integer.toHexString(int) of Problem.getId() as identifier, Enum.name() of Problem.getType(), Problem.getNumRows() as String, Problem.getNumColumns() as String, Enum.name() of Problem.getDifficulty(), Problem.getCreatorName()]
        Parameters:
        problemId - The id of a Problem as its hexadecimal representation (see Problem.idAsHex(int)
        Returns:
        A String array of 6 fields
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Could not read the data from the file because it is either locked or it does not have enough permissions
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - The file can not be loaded
        See Also:

      • getHint

        public java.lang.String[] getHint(java.lang.String[][] solution,
                                  java.lang.String adjacency,
                                  int columns,
                                  int rows,
                                  java.lang.String type,
                                  int lastNumber)
        Returns the position and the number of the next step of a started player Attempt, empty string if no solution found;
        Parameters:
        solution - the current player's solution to a problem
        adjacency - the adjacency attribute of the problem being solved
        columns - the number of columns of the solution
        rows - the number of rows of the solution
        type - the type attribute of the problem being solved
        lastNumber - the last number added to the solution by the player
        Returns:
        The x and y position of the following number of a solution if solvable, empty string otherwise

      • loadProblemFromPath

        public java.lang.String[] loadProblemFromPath(java.lang.String path)
                                       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                              java.io.IOException,
                                              java.text.ParseException,
                                              CtrlDomain.ProblemExistsException,
                                              CtrlDomain.ProblemNotValidException
        Loads a problem from a text file. See Problem.readProblemFromFile(String, String) for formatting requirements.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the file to be loaded
        Returns:
        Whether or not the file has been successfully loaded and added to problemCollection
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Thrown when the passed path does not link to a file.
        java.io.IOException - Can be thrown by Problem.readProblemFromFile(String, String)
        java.text.ParseException - The file does not fulfil the format requirements.
        CtrlDomain.ProblemExistsException
        CtrlDomain.ProblemNotValidException
        See Also:
        Problem.readProblemFromFile(String, String)

      • generateProblem

        public java.lang.String[] generateProblem(java.lang.String type,
                                          int numRows,
                                          int numColumns,
                                          java.lang.String difficulty,
                                          boolean cornerAdjacent)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                          java.io.IOException
        Generates a new Problem with the parameters passed.
        Parameters:
        type - A String corresponding with the name of a Type
        numRows - The number of rows the new game should have
        numColumns - The number of columns the new game should have
        difficulty - A String corresponding with the name of a Difficulty
        cornerAdjacent - Whether fields sharing a corner should be counted as neighbours or only those sharing a face (not relevant for HexagonProblems).
        Returns:
        The displayable information of the generated Problem as generated by displayableProblemInfo(Problem), or an empty String array if adding the new Problem to problemCollection failed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Is thrown if one of the argumets is in the wrong format. Should be caught.
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        Generator.generate(Type, int, int, Difficulty, String, boolean)

      • generatePersonalizedProblem

        public java.lang.String[] generatePersonalizedProblem(java.lang.String type,
                                                      int numRows,
                                                      int numColumns,
                                                      java.lang.String difficulty,
                                                      boolean cornerAdjacent,
                                                      java.lang.String[][] map)
                                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                      java.io.IOException
        Parameters:
        type - A String corresponding with the name of a Type
        numRows - The number of rows the new game should have
        numColumns - The number of columns the new game should have
        difficulty - A String corresponding with the name of a Difficulty
        cornerAdjacent - Whether fields sharing a corner should be counted as neighbours or only those sharing a face (not relevant for HexagonProblems).
        map - A map to be used in the problem generation
        Returns:
        The displayable information of the generated Problem as generated by displayableProblemInfo(Problem), or an empty String array if adding the new Problem to problemCollection failed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Is thrown if one of the argumets is in the wrong format. Should be caught.
        java.io.IOException - Could not read from a Problem file

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getRankingPlayer()
                                                       throws java.io.IOException,
                                                              java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Gets a RankingPlayer previously stored in the system
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of strings, in each even position of the array there is the name of the player and the following odd position has its points.

        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Outdated Attempt file

        private java.lang.String[] displayableProblemInfoAttempt(Problem p,
                                                         Attempt a)
        Returns the info from a problem in a way that allows it to be displayed and the attempt attached to it
        Parameters:
        p - a Problem
        a - an Attempt
        Returns:
        the info to be displayed in a String array
